author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday decided to focus on seven resolves of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and strengthen the party organisation at the village level. Besides Mr. Kumar, State party president Bashistha Narayan Singh, legislators and district presidents attended the meeting.

The leaders also mulled over the upcoming merger of the JD(U) with the Rashtriya Lok Dal of Ajit Singh and making the government’s decision for total prohibition of liquor successful in the State.

After reconstitution of party’s district committees, it was the first meeting of the party in which a large number of party leaders participated. .

“How responsibilities could be fixed to the party cadres and leaders in executing and making the government’s programmes successful upt o the village level was the main agenda of the meeting”, party leaders told the media.

“Party offices will be opened even at panchayat level to fix responsibility of party leaders in executing the government’s programmes for the common people”, said a party leader.

Later, the JD(U) may also explore options to merge with the Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (JVM) of Babulal Marandi “for which talks are under way”, said a party leader.

At the meeting it was also decided to kick-off party membership drive from the month of June.

The leaders also mulled over the upcoming merger with the Rashtriya Lok Dal of Ajit Singh
title: JD(U) to focus on Nitish’s resolves
